text: Can... Murky light-yellow pour with a tiny, white collar. The aroma features fuzzy stone fruits - pluot, peach and apricot - accompanied by a lighter note of biscuit malt. Light to medium-bodied and raspy with prickly carbonation. The flavor features grassy, herbal and peppery hops. This leans slightly toward the bitter side of balance, but is nicely rounded overall. Finishes grassy and Sahara-dry. Nice. Can courtesy of Brandon at Orchid Island Brewery!

pint can, courtesy and shared with Pierre T. Canned May 2nd 2017, 8h33.
Dorée/orangée assez trouble, col blanc crémeux.
Arôme au bouquet de jus pressé, rappel de pas mal dagrumes, mandarine, bouquet renforcé de fruits tropicaux avec une pointe de résineux en retrait.
Plais est bien houblonné, le tout bien amer avec ample apport dagrumes. Retrouve une petite douceur de mandarine, résineux, petite touche surette dananas (surement El Dorado) avec un effet épicé venant de la levure et dune impression de poudre dail.
Leffet de sécheresse est dautant plus accentué, base des Trillium, que cette dernière est double dry-hopper. Le malt ne joue quun rôle de balance et arrive en fin de bouche, pâle - caraMunich, en dessous de lapport des houblons.

Pours a very hazy, light orange-peach color, with smallish head. Aroma has some citrus and a dank, "old washcloth" smell. Flavor is very floral, with tons of citrus, especially lime and grapefruit notes, and a lot of hop bite as well. Its a really tasty beer.

16oz can. Pours hazy pale golden yellow with a tiny white head. Aroma is pine, wood, grapefruit, lime, orange, grass, floral hops, and resin. Taste is pine, grapefruit, caramel, orange, floral, and a touch of lime. Lightly bitter. Alcohol in the finish. Medium body. Slightly prickly but average carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Light astringency in the finish immediately after pouring, but it disappears after the beer settles. Very good, but I think I prefer the regular version of Sleeper Street - the mouthfeel is a little smoother and resonant.  The smaller aroma on the non-DDH version also allows the fruits to shine a little brighter.

Good IPA. Very balanced & smooth, good hop forward flavor. Enjoyed. Ccccccccccccccccc

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can in trade 7pm yesterday with AFHops, thanks Chris. Chris told me make sure you enjoys these beers within 2 weeks. :-) Great burst of hop aroma as the can was cracked open at 11:45am, its 5 oclock in my head. Foamy disappearing offwhite-murky yellowish. A-floral/spice/resin/wood/citrus/cat pee, some lt malt. T-follows with a slight carbonic component. Well done.

16oz can. Murky golden yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are lychee, passion fruit, citrus zest and resinous hops with spicy and grassy notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Draft at taproom. Pours pineapple yellow with a white head. Leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Notes of
Toasted pinecone and citrus on the nose. Bigger pine cone on the tongue balanced nicely by citrus hop notes. Finished clean. My fave from Trillium so far.

Can at The Local Pub, Athen. Pours hazy dark golden/amber with a small creamy off white head. Aroma is strong citrus, light cat piss, dank hops and pine. Taste is very good, medium bodied, with pine needles, citrus, grapefruit, long dank hoppy finish, very good.

April 13, 2017. Can at home, courtesy of James, thanks! 
Cloudy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy with pawpaw, peach, mango, orange, lemon, some light grassy notes, crackers. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Medium bodied, slightly dry, average carbonation. Finish is fruity with a light peach and candied orange sweetness, some bready notes, smooth grassy bitterness with a zesty note. 
Nice.

500ml can thanks to Eric. Pours hazy amber with medium foamy head. Nose grassy and oily. Lemon oils, malt, piny hops. Not as expressive as I would have expected. Taste quite grassy and oily. Wet hops, lemon oils, passion fruits, resinous notes. Finish grassy and oily. Quite floral. Soft palate, medium bodied. Spicy finish with light alcohol bite. I expected a bit more from this. Overall quite grassy and oily. There are some really nice elements in there but feels a borderline messy.

16oz can purchased at Fort Point. Pours Golden orange with some high carbonation. Small foamy off white head lasting on a thin layer. Smells fruity hoppy. Some earthy dank to the hops as well. Some citrus and mango up front with a small malty backbone. Very smooth, and fruity. Little to no malty caramel flavor so it is dominated by the smooth citrus/passion fruit. Very nice. The hoppy kick is substantially lower than Trilliums bigger DIPAs which is nice in a different way. Great dry finish. Great Trillium mouthfeel. Full and lasting but smooth and lighter than the Imperials. Very enjoyable.
Murky light orange pour, 1 finger of white head, webs of lace. Stonefruit and citrus in the aroma. Peach and grapefruit up front, floral, fruit juice, very grassy. Medium body, light astringency.

Tasted from can. Pours a murky orange with white head. Aroma is grapefruit and citrus notes. Taste is well balanced with flavors of grapefruit, floral, caramel, orange, some earthy resin. Very well done IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very appreciated gift. A grapefruit bomb, but I expected more elegance. Really very good.

Poured from can thanks Chris DeMont hazy grapefruit color with a nice white head. Aromas of lemongrass grapefruit lime and floral notes. Taste is nice light and airy with good juicy fruit pineapple melon and grass.

Gift from the States, thanks Oliver @ Budapest.
Poured a hazy orange body under a foamy white head. Aroma/flavor of grains, lime, cat piss, tangerines and citrus rind. Medium body with average carbonation.

Can at home. Totally hazy golden with a medium white head. Looks really good! Aroma is citrus and some floral notes, maybe a hint of tropical fruits too. Taste is a wide spectra of citrus...lime, lemon and grapefruit, both juice and zest, and those floral notes.

Pours hazy, etc. tastes like tropical fruit and cocoa powder. Citrus, beef, apple

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

So, I stopped into a local liquor store the other day, and the guy working the counter talked me into some beer I hadnt planned on buying, even though I was in a hurry. Then he asked if I liked Trillium, and I said Id never had it. He said he came into a 6-pack personally, and I could stop by the store the following day and pick up a can. I asked how much he wanted and he said nothing. The next day, work kept me from getting to the store while he was there. I called to tell him "Thanks, but just drink it yourself". Turns out he lives in my town and was willing to meet me when I got home to give me the can he originally offered. So, thanks Albi! Very good beer, nice to have met you, even though I know youre not on Ratebeer. Thanks for my first Trillium!

Wielkie piwo, chmielowy sok z ananasa, mega. Bardzo świeże i rześkie, mógłbym pić litrami. Wyśmienity, na maksa owocowy smak chmielowy, bardzo długi, owocowy finisz. Goryczka jest na tyle owocowa i schowana w głębokich posmakach że ciężko jako tako powiedzieć że tutaj w ogóle jest :) Thanks, Matthew!

Can @ overtryksventilen. Pours absolutely opaque orange with a white head. Aroma of ripe tropics fruits, yeasty, earthy, orange, slight pinapple. Taste is rather bitter with loads if tropical fruits, slight note of gasolin. Dry and bitter

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA

APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con algunos destellos naranjas, se observa totalmente turbia. Corona de espuma color blanco, de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: algo floral y predominantemente cítrica, notas a mandarina, naranja, toronja, lima, algo herbal, como pasto recién cortado, resina e inclusive ligeramente terroso, por ahí algo de las maltas se asoma pero muy ligeramente.

SABOR: de entrada un amargor medio, le siguen las notas cítricas que predominan, nuevamente mandarina, naranja, toronja, lima, algo floral, herbal como pasto y resina, también algo terroso, las maltas apenas se asoman para darle soporte a los lúpulos, biscuty o como galleta neutra. El retrogusto es un amargor medio largo, ligeramente seco.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con sensación oleosa en boca, mediana carbonatación.

RESUMEN: buena selección de lúpulos.

Growler that had a hard 10 day trip here. Cloudy orange. Zesty aroma of orange, grapefruit and wood. Not my favorite hop combo, but thats just a testament to Trilliums quality cause this is still quite good. Moderate bitterness on the palate with lower carb due to the trip.

(16oz can) super cloudy gold, no real head. Nose of citrus juice, touch chalky, orange pulp, not bitter just juicy. Taste of citrus peel, low bitterness, very juicy, touch of pine, dry hops are prominent, juicy medium thick finish.
can, 5 day old. VERY hazy pour. Pineapple, grapefruit, slight onion notes. Medium bodied with some orange notes on the tongue. Destinct El Dorado. Very nice
Can - pours yellow gold white head - nose/taste of citrus, juicy grapefruit, orange peel and pith and biscuit malt - medium body
Can @ hotel in Holland. Hazy golden yellow with a generous head. Tons of grapefruit, some floral notes, light minty, juicy hops and a light bitterness.

Can, by way of trade with jmbeergeek. Thanks Joe! Pretty hazy, pale gold. Film and halo of lasting, white head. Nose has bright grapefruit. Lemon sherbet. Some white grape skin. Theres also an underlying twang, not unlike a hint of brett. Not sure what that might be, but its not detrimental. Taste is light, juicy citrus bitter. Soft and foamy mouthfeel. Nice juice. Super drinkable. Its like swigging grapefruit juice. Soft, fruity citrus on the finish. Nice one.

5 weeks old can. Pours hazy yellow orange with a white head. Aroma of wet hop pallets, dank planty hops, citrus, mint and peach. Taste of dank hops, orange, mint, wet hops, slight malt and some bready notes.

From can acquired at Hop Duvel! Pours a hazy orange with a medium sized, white head. Aroma has pineapple, ripe sweet orange, light caramel malts, tangerine, wet hopped beer. Taste is sweet, spicy minty, slight malty and pretty planty too. Rather bitter for a trillium beer. High carbonation and a smooth body.
Can from Hop Duvel. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of pine, resin, orange, citrus, dank, wet grass. Taste has resin, orange, dank hops, citrus, pineapple, mandarin.
16 ounce can. Pours a hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and pine. Taste is pineapple, orange, grapefruit, melons, pine, and floral. Delicious.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with an averaged sized head. Floral, pine, citrus, and fruity. Nice and hoppy with some dankiness.

Can thanks to Team North Jersey. Pours a cloudy orange gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is grass and grapefruit. Medium body, juicy, grass, pine, grapefruit, dusty, light bitterness, very good.
Can thanks to Tim! Aroma is very woody with some citrus and herbs. Taste the same. Nice and smooth but Ive never been a huge fan of El Dorado hops. Pretty good though.

Hazy golden orange body, medium sized off-white head, dense soapy lacing. Orange rind, grapefruit, papaya, cantaloupe, mango, tropical flowers. Medium bodied, smoot, soft carbonation, lively bitterness, refreshing finish.

Pours a hazy orange honey color with a thick and fluffy white head...nice lacing. Aroma has nice orange and hoppy spice...citrus rind, passionfruit. Flavor follows suit...some grassiness...really tasty. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with a dry earthy/rindy finish...pretty bitter.
Can. Golden pour with white head. Herbal, grassy, floral and dank aromas. Flavors are herbal, dank and grassy hop tones.

16oz can thanks to Steve. Pours out a cloudy peach color topped with a small white head. Nose is tropical fruit melon some grassy not sure and a nice sweetness. Taste is more of the tropical fruit notes nice sweetness and little bitterness.
Cloudy golden, minimal head. Pineapple, light orange. Quite bitter. Long finish. Good.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the can! Poured into a snifter showing unfiltered cloudy orange with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows an intense but clean mix of juicy tropical fruit - mango, guava, and passionfruit. One of the best noses ever. 

The palate is fully carbonated and medium bodied. Flavors of light mango with resinous pine and a light bitterness on the finish. Flavor is a little light compared to the fantastic nose but still excellent.
Some lime and some pine. Guava a d pineapple. Golden pour with good head and lacing. Sweet and tangy finish. Tall can thanks to Matt.
From a bottle at the RateBeer gathering 9/9/16. Pours a cloudy gold with an off white head. Aroma of a mandarin orange. Flavors of spicy lemon, Crisp clean finish,
Can. Cloudy to murky golden yellow color. Nice fruity perfume aroma. Taste has scant bitterness, straw and citrus.

Can, much thanks to Dave for the pickup. Pours out a straight up orange juice color. Aroma is of dank hops, cat piss, tangerine, juicy apricot, light mango and some tropical notes with mild grain. Taste is solid, juicy citrus fruit, tropical mango, tangerine, cat piss,

Can. Never did I think el dorado was a little good hop. Boy was I wrong. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aromas of some pineapple and grapefruit. Taste is lime and earthy clay. Medium light bitterness. I am such a fanboy now.

Fresh can care of Dave, pours a murky golden orange shade. Smell and flavor are filled with mandarin orange, pine and other old school dank hops. Not overly columbus or off onion notes. Medium bodied. Very bitter in the close, nice ipa juice.
masterful hoppy creation. on tap at the source. dry finish. medium mouthfeel. emphasizibg dry hop flavour.
Bottle shared at my house. Poured a hazy orange body under a foamy white head. Aroma/flavor of grains, lime, cat piss, tangerines and citrus rind. Medium body with average carbonation.

750 ml bottle purchased from the brewery. Pours a murky yellow gray color with a medium sized white head. Unfiltered. Beautiful aroma of floral notes, orange, grapefruit, lemon, lime, hemp, pine and hops. Taste of juicy hops, grapefruit, orange, pineapple, papaya, and pine. Good stuff.

Cloudy yellow with minimal white head. The aroma is a huge burst of orange juice and grapefruit. Medium body, mildly carbonated. Extremely fresh citrusy hop flavor that ends up more sour lemony than bitter. Slightly sweet finish. Quite good, but you better enjoy a big dose of citrus to like this.

750ml bottle from the South Boston brewery, packaged on 3/9/16. Pours a hazy yellow, almost orange with a thin white head and minimal to moderate lacing. Strong citrus aroma with some bubblegum, huge citrus taste with a floral hop and lemon rind finish. Would love to try fresh.

750 ml bottle, thanks to Willrunforbeer on the share. Bright yellow in color, nice level of carbonation. Aroma is lemongrass, pilsner malt, honeysuckle, limes, and grapefruit. 
Flavor has lots of lingering grapefruit after the sip. Notes of pineapple and melon. Nice mouthfeel and body, light and airy. Nicely dry texture. Not my favorite all time from this brewery but still top tier for sure. 

Side note overall rating number 5800. Thanks for another Trillium Brian!

Bottle - Pours cloudy golden with a foamy off-white head. Nose is lemongrass, cucumber, honeydew melon, and a biscuity dry malt base. Taste is the same, with more juicy citrus. Pretty sweet on the finish with some warming heat. Malt doesnt get in the way like all Trillium IPAs, but this hop is just not my thing. Its pleasant like the regular Sleeper Street, but the added ABV and sweetness detracts a bit. Thick, slick, and oily.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours very hazy blond with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of garlic, nuts, pine, menthol. Taste is of garlic, bitterness, menthol. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice.
750ml->tulip, shared by GenDV110+OT, thanks Donnie!! Cloudy orange-gold with small white head. A: huge citrus hops, tropical fruit. T: tropical fruit, citrus peel, floral hops. Awesome.

750 ml bottle shared with DCLawyer and my friend Tyler. Hazy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, floral notes, garlic and onion. Tastes of citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes, garlic and onion. Medium body with a dry finish.

Insane lemon zest aroma smacks you right in the face. Hints of pepper and cut grass. Flavor is tropical and cracked pepper with s huge lemony zest finish. Mango juice appearance and a moderate to medium full body. Overall one of the most unique ipas Ive had in a long time. Incredible.

750 mL bottle. Very cloudy yellow body. Smells fascinating. Lime, grapefruit, and a strong pine woody aroma. Tastes equally good. Lime and grapefruit citrus. Sweet pale malt. Some of that pine woodiness in the finish, but its a little muted. Medium body. Absolutely delicious.

10/IV/16 - 75cl bottle from a trade@ home - BB: n/a, bottled: III/9/16, so one month old, not bad! (2016-349) Thanks to Chris for the trade and Thomas for muling the bottle!
Cloudy bright yellow to orange beer, big irregular yellowish head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: bit lemony, citrus, sourish touch, pretty floral, resinous, bit of paint, candy. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very fruity, pineapple, sweet touch, bitter, resinous, grassy, some citrus. Aftertaste: some alcohol, resinous, little sugary, floral, hoppy, bit grassy, very bitter, resinous.

Hazy yellow body with a half inch of white head. Aromas of canteloupe, assorted melons, grapefruit, tart citrus. The flavor is more of the same. Sweet and tart melon. Hop forward and juicy. Dank and resinous. Tasty!

Aroma: Dry Citrus, Dry Pine...
Appearance: Murky Golden Straw, Passes Mild Light, Thin White Head Ring, Some Lacing...
Taste: Dry Hopped Citrus, Drying Grains...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Bottle from brewery. Pours an opaque hazy light orange, fluffy white head. Aroma is honey, orange, floral notes, grain, citrus, bread, faint vanilla / cream, lime, tangerine. Flavor is gooey citrus, bread, floral, pine, grass, spices, sweet vanilla. Med body, gooey sweet fruits & spices.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Poured from bottle into a pint glass: Pours hazy yellow with a one finger white head. Aroma of citrus, light resin, slight booze. Taste is mildly sweet citrus, grapefruit, orange and lemon zest, nice hop bite. Medium body, dry finish, really awesome.

Pours a cloudy golden with a small white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of fruits, pine and gummies. Taste is of tropical fruits, citrus and slight peppery alcohol. Moderately bitter. Average body and carbonation, juicy mouthfeel. Another really nice hop juicy by Trillium!

Bottle courtesy of SaulTBauls, in a location remote of my library. 
Pours a very hazy bright yellow with a small but reasonably well intentioned head. 

The aroma is big with lots of bright citrus (grapefruit and lime particularly, but it seems like theres a bit of orange zest in the mix) Its got some light floral sweetness to the bouquet, but yeah mostly its a big bright citrusy hop thing, which is just lovely. 

The flavor is lightly bitter with a whole bunch of lime zest & grapefruit. Its got an impossibly bright hop character that dominates everything and gives illusions of sweetness to an otherwise pretty dry beer. The malt character is mild but clean and not entirely buried. 

A winner.

pours cloudy very light golden with a small white cap offering good retention and lacing. nutty melon maltiness, tons of limes, spicy and peppery hearty melons, yummy onions and garlic, clementines, clean yeast. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily; smooth and balanced spicy-citrusy finish. tasty yet awkward peanut butter angles - still pretty nice ipa.

750ml bottle from share at dmacs. Poured a milky straw color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of orange pineapple juice!! Taste is much the same. Lots of orange and pineapple juices, caramel malt, grass, lemon, and citrus zest.

Juste wow ! Du jus de houblon.
Nez assez léger mais assez complexe et équilibré : toutes les nuances de houblon sont là, agrumes, tropicaux, herbacées, florales.
Bouche très douce et dune buvabilite extraordinaire : du jus de fruit. Aucune trace dalcool, juste des sensations fraîches de prairie, detal de primeurs, dherbes fraîchement coupée.
On passerait sa vie le nez dedans et on ne boirait que cela. Équilibre parfait.
NB : bue une semaine après brassage.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours very hazy milky yellow with a creamy white head that leaves plenty of trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity and slightly grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, papaya, raspberries, blackberries, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste bitter, tiny sour, fruity and slightly grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny dry, very tiny tart, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sour and bitter with raspberries, blackberries, lime juice and grass. Fairly tart and heavy on the blackberry and raspberry character. Good but not my favourite.

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Cloudy yellow beer with a nice white head. Hoppy citrus and pine flavor, passion fruit, peach, tangerines, pine apples, some grapes. Hoppy pine and peach flavor, cedar, tangerines, orange zest, pine apples, some lemon juice. Fresh and tasty.
A: Cloudy white/yellow/brownish with a white head. N: Minerals, papaya, macadamia nut T: Lime, mushrooms, papaya, orange zest, mango O: Fresh forest juice!
Pours murky pale golden with a small head. Aroma is fruity berry hoppy piny some raspberries. Flavor is smooth grassy hoppy fruity bitter and pungent.
750, more lemon and grass than the first version. Moderate bitterness, more bitter than regular sleeper. Great stuff and very high drinkability.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Dusty yeast, passion fruit and grapefruit aromas. Soft with sweet tropical fruit upfront turning to mild marshmallow, citrus and resin in the lasting finish. Liked this more than the regular Sleeper St.

Oh the riddle that is the El Dorado hop. Do I like them or hate them? Appearance is a cloudy yellow almost orange juice appearance with white head. Aroma is resin, candied orange peel, earthy leaves, cedar, and grass. Taste is light bitter crisp and a bit of caramel sweetness but the El Dorado hop in this much quantity is super earthy resin like taking a big bite out of the ground in a pine forest.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of strong citrusy and floral and lightly spicy hops, some pale malts, and light dough. Flavor the same with strong hops but not my favorite hop. Average texture. A cool beer but not the best only because this hop isnt my favorite.

Utterly cloudy, dull ochre-orange beer, with almost no head left. Very flowery, citrussy hop; grapefruit galore, Bergamot lime. Very bitter-resiny at first, but strangely enough also bitter chocolate, liquorice, rosewater, grapefruit, passion fruit and wheat. Finish is surprisingly mild, almost sweet, rosewater and lychee dominating. Bit astringent in the mouth, very dry-hopoily; slick. Sample probably no longer in the best condition; in any case surprising aromas and flavours.  Many thanks to Louis and Mathieu!

Bottle split at LKS 15K Tasting, big thanks to LKS, 02/11/15. 
Hazed golden amber with a big old off white covering.
Nose is pissy citrics, pine neddle, dank hops, grapefruit.
Taste comprises pine needle, grapefruit, citric tinged straw, light spice, orange pith, melon, bread dough.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with dank hop strokes.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell, many thanks to Leighton. Dark orange, lightly sparkling, hazy, small foamy dense white head. Aroma is sherbet, lime muddled with sugar, oily mint, pink sherbet tubes from my youth, fruit cocktail. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is sherbety sweet, zesty fruits, pine, tangerine, dry chalky finish. A very accomplished IPA, perhaps a touch sweet.

Bottle. Pours cloudy Arnold Palmer, medium off-white head, creamy and dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is pine trees, resin, a bit herbal. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, very piney and resinous, faint melon. Lingering bitterness. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Solid beer, but not up to Trillium standard.

2nd November 2015Craft Clerkenwell. LKS 15K bash. Thanks to Leighton for another Trillium treat. Hazy orange - gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Palate is light, fairy dry and crisp. Thin malts bring mild creamy sweetness. Hop spice bites and there is mild hop skunk. Tangerine, pine and lemon ensue. Finishes smooth and semi dry. Hop spice lingers on. Nice balance of hop attributes here.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis, split three ways. Pours like hazy pineapple juice with decent head. This beer is something of an enigma to me. On alternating sips I either loved it (had this really cool sweet orange blossom creamsicle juice thing going on) or was disappointed by it ("green," a little too sweet, more caramel showing than I like, not enough balancing bitterness). But then that orange blossom creamcicle thing would happen again and Id think, "damn ... I get it, this is delicious." And then Id lose it again -- like one of those optical illusion posters I used to stare at as a kid. So depending on which mode Im in, this is either like a 4.1 or 3.5, so Im going to average it out to a 3.8. Definitely one of the more puzzling beers Ive had in a while, which is a lot of fun.
750ml bottle pours a hazy yellow Amber color with a bit of head. Tropical fruit flavor that linger. Pineapple and passionfruit.

Bottle shared at the 10k 15k tasting at craft beer co. Aroma is big juicy fruits, tropical, pineapple, little dank, mango. Translucent golden orange coloured pour with a lasting loose white head. Flavour is composed of juicy tropical, pez sweets, mango juice, tangy orange . palate is frothy and velvety. Firm juicy clean bitterness. Supurb.

Bottle at Leightons 15K thanks to the man himself! The nose is fresh, fragrant, floral, daisy, soft orange, tangerine, honeysuckle and dried mango. The taste is crisp, bitter, big zesty citrus action, sherbet, minerals, pine needles, orange peel and grapefruit with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, prickly carbonation. Aroma is particularly great. Nice one.

Bottle shared in London at CBC Clerks during the 15k tasting. Picked up in trade. Pours unclear gold with a fluffy white head. The nose, not surprisingly, is immensely hoppy, with plenty of pine, tangerine, grapefruit, perfume. Medium sweet flavor with some white grape gummies, pale bread, wheat, tangerine, nectarine. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Resinous finish, loads of sticky and dank hops, pale bread, grapefruit, pine. A little bit of dryness in the aftertaste. Great stuff overall.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Citrus hop bouquet. Taste follows suit with orange and caramel malt undercurrents. Good body and mouthfeel.

Translucent orange, very nice foam topper. Tropical aroma, guava and mango, and some dank notes. Grapefruit flavor with grainy bitterness. Nice beer overall but a tad too assertive bitterness for my taste.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2015 750mL bottled on 10/0X/15 (cant quite make it out), drunk very fresh on 10/20/15.Large rocky white head atop a moderately hazy, but thankfully not cloudy, pale golden liquid with plentiful carbonation. Retention is strong. Another perfect appearance as usual.Tons of lemon, guava, moderate leafiness of the hops but not altogether quite as deeply tropical as the regular version. Not that thats a bad thing. This one is still highly aromatic, but with some deeper, more dank and at the same time starker citrusy notes. So its a bit of an odd one, the bright, sharp, nearly tart lemony citrus notes combined with the more earthy, spicy, floral notes. Still, works perfectly fine and I like that there are no obtuse pine or grapefruit notes. No alcohol and very sparse (though ample) malts in the nose providing biscuits, crackers and a touch of sourdough.Bitter lemon and lime, with some sourdough-like malt notes (or is that just some tangy hop resin? hard to tell), dry, acidic pineapple and melon and honey on the finish. Hmmm, interesting. The attenuation is clearly spot-on (tending perhaps a touch sweet, but its appropriate to balance), just like in the regular version. The hops are a bit more dubious here, for me, however. Very dry and bitter, with some Galaxy-like notes (I say Galaxy-like when I get a very fuzzy, acidic, almost capsaicin-like feel from the hops). It definitely hits hard on the end, giving just a bit more tanginess/punchiness than Id like, especially in the face of the acidity and dryness. Some more lighthearted mango, papaya and even some sweet pineapple could work wonders here. Its odd to think the normal and ddh versions could be that much different, but I certainly am not nearly as impressed by what the dry hopping has done here. That being said, its still an excellent, drinkable IPA with classic Trillium texture/carbonation (perfect).

22oz bottle via trade. It pours a cloudy dark orange / amber color with a medium white head. Aroma is rich bold sweet hops with notes of tropical fruits and pungent dank weed. Taste is mellow sweet stone fruits, tropical fruit salad, light toffee, weird spices, some light citrus orange and dank weed. Medium bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, nice juicy and bold but the weird spicy hops male it a question mark

Slightly hazy light orange with to bright yellow appearance with thin white head and lacing. Big juicy hops along with pine. Based on the aroma I would have thought it to be a bit sweeter and chewy, but still very good.
Hazy light peach power, small white head. Aroma of peach, apricot, flavor hugely of apricot, with notes of peach, grapefruit, melon... fantastic.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks solid; a very hazy darker apricot with foamy white head. Smells good; juicy, piney, bitter, and floral hops with a mild to moderately bittersweet backbone. A bit of caramel as well, but its mild and well-balanced, and doesnt detract from the hops.  Tastes like it smells with a pleasant medium-bodied mouthfeel. Some spruce and lemongrass on the tongue as well. A good IPA.
750 ml bottle thanks to John. April 17 date. A nice bright yellow, but then followed by this odd dank floral aroma and taste. Pretty dank.

Pours a hazy bright yellow/orange. Aromas are heavy citrus and some floral. Flavor was mainly orange and I got some grass and straw in there too. Light body with a slick texture. Overly carbed though and was really fizzy and bitey on the tongue, kind of like orange flavored pop. Not a bad offering at all, just not my favorite. Still very good.
Lemon and lime flavor dominate the aroma and flavor. A beautiful hazy straw appearance. Pours a bright white head. Great mouth feel.

Bottle: Slightly hazy, golden-amber body with a soft, off-white head that doesnt last. Smells like damn Fruity Pebbles. Tons of fruit; grapefruit, lemon, berries, sugar-crusted orange slivers. Light undertones of flowers, white pepper, & a small hint of perfume. Flavor is also very fruity. Melon, tangerine, strawberry, lemon rind, even some blueberry. Slightly grassy, small notes of pine, perfume, & florals with a touch of ashy leaves in the back-end. Finishes clean, really tasty.

Bottle from Tommy, thanks man. Apperance is hazy yellow with thick white head. Aroma is oranges, lemon, and light floral tones. Taste is orange, lemon, pine, bitter crisp finish. Medium bodied, lots of carb. Overall, this has a nice amount of bitterness and some intersting orange and citrus undertones, refrshing and tasty.

Bottle shared. Hazy gold pour with thick frothy white head with spotty lacing. Aroma is really weird, tons of spruce, lemon grass, spicy woody aroma, car freshener, very intense. Taste is bitter, very woody, spicy, cinnamon, spruce, lemongrass, harsh. Palate is med bodied with good carbonation. I cant quite put my finger on what this beer smells like, but its a bit intense.

Live from NH. Bottle (750 ml). Bottles on 17-04-2015, so 1 day old. From Jon, thanks! Split 3-ways with Chris and Julien.

Appearance: Muddy glowing yellow with a medium easy to revive white head and good lacing.

Aroma: Oh that is weird... its a burst of a mix of lemongrass and spicy wood like spruce. Theres also some mangoes and honeyed notes. 

Taste: Its as weird as the aroma with lemongrass, spruce, a good malt backbone and a very low bitterness level. Sweetness is rather low too.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. A bit oily and with the usual Trillium mouthfeel depth. A bit dry. 

Overall: The body is nice and the base beer seems to be really good but the front aroma/flavors of lemongrass and spruce is just to weird so the drinkability/enjoyability is hindered.

Bottle from thegerm. Thanks man! Poured after Galaxy Fort Point on 3/2/15, bottle dated 2/11/15. Pours hazy golden color with a creamy, fluffy white head on top. Aroma is a bit more malt forward than the GFP, with sweet notes of honey and melon, mango, pineapples, tropical citrus. Flavor is sweet papaya and melon, some pineapple in the background, low bitter and higher on the sweetness. Medium bodied, medium low carbonation, dank and more syrupy than the others (not in a bad way). Some interesting malty bready flavors lingering on the finish. A good bit of offerer from others from Teillium that Ive had this far. Almost like sweet melon juice and the hops are surprisingly mellow here given the supposed large dry hop. Nice.

750ml bottle pours a hazy pineapple gold with foamy white head. Nose has some dank notes, flower pollen, lemony, some tropical fruit, pineapple. Flavor has honey, guava, mango, dank, flower pollen, some lemon, some pineapple. Slick finish.
Cloudy gold/yellow colored pour. Small white head. Plenty of lacing. Aromas of orange juice and slight pine. Taste is the same with a dankness. Delicious.
